titleInfo.title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-11-28 - Part 2

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 28, 1942. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Rachel Veach, Bashful Brother Oswald, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalists San Antonio Rose and Eddy Arnold, the John Daniel Quartet, Pap's Jug Band, and Minnie Pearl. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
